sentences.sentence: We were after her now.
With every vibration( 震动 ) of the engines we sprang and quivered( 抖动 ) like a living thing.
We flashed past barges( 驳船 ) and merchant-ships, in and out, behind this one and round the other.
Voices called us out of the darkness, but still the Aurora rushed on, and still we followed close upon her track.
The twilight( 黄昏 ) was setting into a clear starlit( 星光闪耀的 ) night.
Our boilers were strained( 尽量使用 ) to their utmost( 极限 ), and the frail( 脆弱的 ) shell( 框架 ) shook and creaked with the fierce energy which was driving us along.
Jones turned our searchlight( 探照灯 ) upon the Aurora, so that we could plainly see the figures upon her deck( 甲板 ).
Steadily we caught up with( 追上 ) them, yard by yard.
We were not more than four boat’s lengths behind them when the man in the stern( 船尾 ) sprang up from the deck( 甲板 ) and shook his fists at us, cursing( 咒骂 ) in a high, cracked( 嘶哑的 ) voice.
I could see that from the thigh( 大腿 ) downwards there was but a wooden stump( 假腿 ) upon the right side.
Suddenly a little black man appeared—the smallest I have ever seen—with a great, misshapen( 畸形的 ) head and tangled( 凌乱的 ) hair, and a face that was enough to give a man a sleepless night.
His small eyes glowed( 发亮 ) and burned with a cruel light, and his teeth grinned( 露齿笑 ) at us with a half animal fury( 暴怒 ).
Holmes and I took out our guns at the sight of this savage, distorted( 扭曲的 ) creature.
“Fire if he raises his hand,” said Holmes, quietly.
We were within a boat’s length by this time, and could almost reach out and touch them.
It was lucky that we had so clear a view of him.
Even as we looked he took out a short, round piece of wood, like a school-ruler, and put it to his lips.
Our guns rang out together.
He whirled( 旋转 ) round and fell sideways( 往一侧 ) into the white swirl( 旋涡 ) of the waters.
At the same moment the wooden-legged man turned the boat into the southern bank.

It was a wild and desolate( 荒凉的 ) place, where the moon glimmered upon a wide( 宽阔的 ) expanse( 宽阔的区域 ) of marshland( 沼泽地 ), with pools of stagnant( 污浊的 ) water and beds of decaying( 腐烂 ) vegetation( 植被 ).
The fugitive( 逃亡者 ) sprang out, but his stump( 假腿 ) instantly sank its whole length into the muddy soil.

When we brought our launch( 汽艇 ) alongside he was so firmly stuck that it was only by throwing the end of a rope over his shoulders that we were able to haul( 拉 ) him out, and to drag him, like some evil( 邪恶的 ) fish, over our side.
The two Smiths, father and son, sat unhappily in their launch( 汽艇 ), but came aboard meekly( 温顺地 ) enough when commanded.
The Aurora herself we hauled( 拖 ) off and made fast to our stern( 船尾 ).
A solid iron chest of Indian workmanship( 工艺 ) stood upon the deck( 甲板 ).
There was no key, and it was of considerable weight, so we transferred( 转移 ) it carefully to our own little cabin( 船舱 ).
“See here,” said Holmes, pointing to the wooden door of our boat’s cabin( 船舱 ). “We were hardly quick enough with our guns.”
There, just behind where we had been standing, stuck one of those murderous darts( 刺 ) which we knew so well.
It must have whizzed between us at the instant that we fired.
It made me sick to think of the horrible death which had passed so close to us that night.
On our return we flashed our searchlight( 探照灯 ) in every direction, but there was no sign of the Islander.
Somewhere in the dark mud at the bottom of the Thames lie the bones of that strange visitor to our shores.
Our prisoner sat in the cabin( 船舱 ) opposite( 在对面 ) the iron box which he had done so much and waited so long to gain.
The lines and wrinkles all over his sunburned( 晒黑的 ) face told of a hard, open-air life.
“Well, Jonathan Small,” said Holmes, lighting a cigar, “I am sorry that it has come to this.”
“And so am I, sir,” he answered, frankly. “I give you my word I did not kill Mr. Sholto. It was Tonga who shot one of his cursed( 受诅咒的 ) darts( 刺 ) into him.
I punished Tonga for it, but it was done, and I could not undo it.”
“Have some whisky( 威士忌酒 ),” said Holmes, “so you don’t catch cold. How could you expect this black fellow to overpower( 制服 ) Mr. Sholto?”
“You seem to know as much about it as if you were there, sir.
The truth is that I hoped to find the room empty. It was the time when Mr. Sholto usually went down to his supper.
I shall make no secret of( 对...不加隐瞒 ) the business. The best defense( 辩护 ) that I can make is just the simple truth.
Now, if it had been the old major I would have been happy to kill him. But it’s unfair that I should be punished over this young Sholto, with whom I had no quarrel.”
“Mr. Athelney Jones, of Scotland Yard, will bring you up to my rooms, and I shall ask you for a true account of the matter.
If you tell the truth, I may be of use to you.
I think I can prove that the poison acts so quickly that the man was dead before ever you reached the room.”
“He was, sir. It fairly shook me, sir, to see him dead like that.
How you found me is more than I can tell.
I don’t have any hard feelings towards you. But it does seem a queer( 奇怪的 ) thing,” he added, with a bitter smile,

“that I who have a good claim to( 对...有所有权 ) half a million pounds should spend the first half of my life breaking stones in the Andamans, and am likely to spend the other half digging ditches( 沟渠 ) at Dartmoor.
It was an evil( 倒霉的 ) day for me when I ever saw the merchant Achmet and had to do with the Agra treasure.
To Achmet it brought murder, to Major Sholto it brought fear and guilt, to me it has meant slavery for life.”
“We shall be at Vauxhall Bridge presently,” said Athelney Jones, “and we shall land you, Dr. Watson, with the treasure-box.
I need hardly tell you that I am taking a very grave( 重大的 ) responsibility( 责任 ) upon myself in doing this.
It is most irregular; but of course an agreement is an agreement.
I must, however, as a matter of duty, send an inspector with you, since you have so valuable an item( 一件物品 ).
It is a pity there is no key, that we may make an inventory( 详细目录 ) first. You will have to break it open.
Bring the box back with you to the Baker Street rooms. You will find us there, on our way to the station.”

article_info.previous: 一顿愉快的晚餐过后，Holmes一行人开始了最终的追捕行动，Holmes白天已经找到了Aurora号所在的修船场，并且与线人约定好以手帕作为行动的信号。当他们到达时并没有看到手帕挥舞，Aurora却飞快地冲出了水面试图逃跑…
article_info.share_words: Suddenly a little black man appeared—the smallest I have ever seen—with a great, misshapen head and tangled hair, and a face that was enough to give a man a sleepless night.

question.cn: 那个野蛮人看起来什么样子？
question.en: What did the savage look like?

options.cn: 他很高，肤色白，有着长头发。
options.en: He was a tall white man with long hair.

options.cn: 他很强壮，肤色黑，没有头发。
options.en: He was a strong black man with no hair.

options.cn: 他体型小，肤色黑，头发凌乱。
options.en: He was a little black man with tangled hair.

analysis: 文中描述：“Suddenly a little black man appeared—the smallest I have ever seen—with a great, misshapen head and tangled hair, and a face that was enough to give a man a sleepless night. ”因此答案选C。

question.cn: 他们成功射杀了那个野蛮人吗？
question.en: Did they manage to shoot and kill the savage?

analysis: 文中提到：“Our guns rang out together. He whirled round and fell sideways into the white swirl of the waters. ”以及后来再次确认：“ On our return we flashed our searchlight in every direction, but there was no sign of the Islander. Somewhere in the dark mud at the bottom of the Thames lie the bones of that strange visitor to our shores.”因此答案选A。

question.en: Why did Jonathan Small fail to escape?

options.cn: 因为他的腿陷进了泥巴里。
options.en: Because his stump had sunk into the muddy soil.
Because the launch was not fast.

analysis: 文中提到：“The fugitive sprang out, but his stump instantly sank its whole length into the muddy soil. When we brought our launch alongside he was so firmly stuck that it was only by throwing the end of a rope over his shoulders that we were able to haul him out, and to drag him, like some evil fish, over our side. ”因此答案选B。

question.cn: 当他们找回了宝藏箱之后，出现了什么问题？
question.en: What was the problem when they had recovered the treasure chest?

options.en: There was no key to it.
It was too heavy to carry.

analysis: 文中提到：“A solid iron chest of Indian workmanship stood upon the deck. There was no key, and it was of considerable weight, so we transferred it carefully to our own little cabin.”因此答案选A。

question.cn: Holmes有关凶手是谁的猜想得到了Jonathan Small的证实吗？
question.en: Was Holmes’ theory about the murderer proved by Jonathan Small?

analysis: 文中Jonathan Small开始解释说：“I give you my word I did not kill Mr. Sholto. It was Tonga who shot one of his cursed darts into him.”又对Holmes感叹道：“You seem to know as much about it as if you were there, sir.”因此答案选A。

share_title: 100天读完4本英文书，今天是第39天
